title: Current - cause of moving charged particles

content.question: Which of the following best describes what causes charged particles to move through a current-carrying wire?

choices.label: An external source of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> produces an electric field in the wire.
Each charged particle produces an electric field in the wire.
Electrons moving in one direction cause the motion of protons in the opposite direction.
One section of the wire has an excess of charged particles, which then move to spread evenly throughout the wire.

content.answer: An external source of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> produces an electric field in the wire.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
